page.title: 16FOREST RANGER West Forres
page.content: Mr. Vic Thomson is a Forest Ranger on the Darnaway Estates.In the mid-summer a typical day might be as follows: at 7.30 a.m. leave the house to check birds' nests.After this he will walk his dog,have beakfast and check his mail.At 9.ooa.m. he visits a local school to talk to the pupils.Eighty children from an Elgin school arrive at 10.00 a.m. to go on a Woodland Walk,complete worksheets prepared by Vic and see cows being milked.At 2.00 p.m. he manages to snatch some lunch.Students of Land Economy from Aberdeen University come to hear him lecture at 2.30p.m.By 4.00p.m. the Visitor Centre will have cleared and he has a short break and evening meal.In the evening he will take a group out to look for Capercaillie and he will return home about 10p.m.He enjoys finding rare butterflies.
